creatures.name: Glutterfly
creatures.desc: These glowing, gigantic insects seem to only come out at night. Their carapace is extremely tough, and they seem generally angry about most things.

creatures.name: Glidopus
creatures.desc: Hovering, three-tentacled cephalopods that make their homes in mud. The Glidopi seem to have an internal beak deep inside their bodies, used to grind food.

creatures.name: Wompit
creatures.desc: These bouncy critters can be found all over the Savanna. They can usually be found munching on Sawgrass with their tough, flat teeth.

creatures.name: Tartil
creatures.desc: It's not clear whether these creatures are made of tar or simply covered in tar. Whatever it is, they're extremely sticky, and they don't seem too happy about it.

creatures.name: Wat
creatures.desc: These little bat-like creatures group together into packs and then viciously swarm anything that comes near. But they're super nice once you get to know them.

creatures.name: Zug
creatures.desc: Zugs are so lazy that they try to avoid moving as much as possible. Because of this, their bodies are packed with a neverending supply of electricity, leftover from their normal metabolic processes.

creatures.name: Vomma
creatures.desc: Vommas have such a powerful self-preservation instinct that they happily sacrifice their tadpole babies to save themselves. It's okay, though... they generate new babies every few seconds.

creatures.name: Throak
creatures.desc: The long, slender tendrils of the Throak can maneuver expertly through the Bawg's system of pores, cleaning them of debris and parasites.

creatures.name: Snorble
creatures.desc: Snorbles are incredibly loud creatures when provoked, but really they just like settling down and reading a good book.

creatures.name: Satgat
creatures.desc: Known as the most awkward of creatures, the Satgat hides behind its pointy hat to make sure nobody sees its puzzled expression.

creatures.name: Wojack
creatures.desc: Is it a worm? Is it a squid? Is it a flower? Yes. It likes to spend a lot of time underground, eating hair follicle roots.

creatures.name: Bamli
creatures.desc: Although it has a terrible diet, the Bamli seems to be in perfect shape, likely due to its ability to plug into the Bawg and siphon energy into itself. It may also have something to do with its amazing moustache.

creatures.name: Shirk
creatures.desc: These amphibious birdfish are able to fly and swim at amazing speeds! They can chomp their beaks so hard it creates a sonic shockwave. Despite this, they make terrible dinner guests.

creatures.name: Glaser
creatures.desc: By harnessing the electromagnetic field of the planet, Glasers can rub atoms together with their antlers to produce a powerful laser. They can also rub sticks together to make fire, but it's way less impressive.

creatures.name: Slurb
creatures.desc: This narcissistic snail-like creature can move so fast it becomes a blur. Though it doesn't really like to, since blurriness isn't the most attractive of features.

creatures.name: Lyff
creatures.desc: Lyffs never evolved to have skulls, so they instead evolved the ability to instantly grow exploding ice shards around their brains. This was a much more complicated solution, but nature isn't perfect.

creatures.name: Blastcrab
creatures.desc: It has a resilient shell that can withstand the intense heat and pressure that is constantly building up inside its body. It also enjoys tennis.

creatures.name: Gallum
creatures.desc: A fusion of Tundra crystals and dead creature parts, this monster has a mystical aura around it. It seems self-conscious about its ribs.

creatures.name: Gulanti
creatures.desc: This friendly little guy becomes horribly enraged when confronted by anything at all. Very hard to housebreak.

tasks.name: Place an item on the Ground
Possess a number of a certain item
Have a creature as a pet
Acquire special items from a certain resource type
Acquire special items from a certain creature type
Drop eligibility for special resource drops

items.name: B.S. S.S. Assess Lander
items.desc: This tiny ship is what you arrived in.

items.name: Stick
items.desc: You notice that if you run with it, you will put your eye out.

items.name: Sawgrassaw
items.desc: Tier 1 saw. A saw made of sawgrass. This is the mediumest quality saw you've ever seen, but it should let you chop down logtrees and whistleroots!

items.name: Sawboard
items.desc: Level 2 Axe. This bad boy is 100% certified organic. ORGANICALLY DEADLY.

items.name: Flatstone
items.desc: This stone is so unbelievably flat you could probably barely squeeze a sheet of paper between it and something else.

items.name: Flatstone Hammer
items.desc: Level 3 Hammer. A high-tech hammer crafted from the finest of flatstones. Used for pounding things. WITH STYLE!

items.name: Logtree
items.desc: This tree appears to be made of logs. You wonder what the people back home would make of this.

items.name: Wompirrito
items.desc: Delicious and healthy, the Wompirrito is a local culinary classic.

items.name: Wooden Floor
items.desc: It has a nicely polished sheen, and you get splinters when you slide your bare feet along it. So don't do that.

items.name: Wooden Wall
items.desc: Forming good relationships is all about putting up walls. Better get to work.

items.name: Bumpberry
items.desc: This berry is purple, which definitely means it's poisonous. Or maybe that was red. In any case, some color means poisonous.

items.name: Sawgrass
items.desc: This grass is super sharp and firm, yet flexible. And it tastes somewhat like lightly toasted marshmallows with a smattering of beef.

items.name: Glutternet
items.desc: Glutterflies go crazy for this kind of crap. Embiggens your Glutterfly to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Sawgrass Blade
items.desc: A blade of sawgrass. When you rub your hand across it, you bleed profusely. But when you rub your hand across it a SECOND time, you continue to bleed profusely.

items.name: Sawgrass Leaf
items.desc: A soft, tender leaf from the Sawgrass plant. It feels good to rub your face on it, though it causes rashes.

items.name: Wompit Sinew
items.desc: A tough tendon from the leg of a Wompit. It's stretchy enough that you might be able to tie your hair up with it, if you weren't in a space suit.

items.name: Log
items.desc: A round piece of wood, harvested from the Logtree plant. You've never seen anything like this!

items.name: Sawdust
items.desc: A byproduct from cutting wood. If you stick your hands in the pile, it feels awesome. And it smells great!

items.name: Sunshroom
items.desc: These shrooms love to grow in mud, and they taste salty. Restores 149 HP.

items.name: Sawmill
items.desc: This workbench with a circular saw will allow you to craft all kinds of wooden masterpieces!

items.name: Stoneshaper
items.desc: What a convenient way to shape rocks into other shapes!

items.name: Sawcle
items.desc: Sawcles have been used in construction for generations!

items.name: Stone Wall
items.desc: Legends say that the Stone Wall was first invented by a one-gloved man with sweet dance moves.

items.name: Crowbar
items.desc: Use it to pry up floors you have placed! Just equip it and poke the floor you want to pry. Or don't; it's up to you, really.

items.name: BRX Sign
items.desc: Signs are great at marking stuff on the map, but they aren't great at dodgeball.

items.name: WompHat
items.desc: Level 3 helm. This will protect your scalp from almost the mightiest of touches.

items.name: Logboots
items.desc: Level 1 boots. They'll keep your feet warm in the cold weather! Well, kinda. Not really. They're wood.

items.name: Logchest
items.desc: Level 1 chestplate. Cover your bosom with this amazing pile of boards to protect your ribs from slight bruising!

items.name: Woodmitts
items.desc: Level 1 gloves. Protect your fat, sausagey fingers WITH THE POWER OF WOOD!

items.name: Bone Gloves
items.desc: Level undefined gloves. These gloves are hard as rocks. Well, bones, actually. But it's close.

items.name: Hydrablade Woodshankers
items.desc: Level 3 legendary gloves. Don't scratch your nose with these bad boys on.

items.name: Baconband
items.desc: Now you can enjoy the sweet scent of baconweed ALL THE TIME! Grants 0.25% HP regeneration every second!

items.name: Loghat
items.desc: Level 1 helm. I'M THE KING OF THE WOOD!

items.name: Baconweed
items.desc: These pretty flowers have a tantalizing aroma. Restores 81 HP.

items.name: Logtree Seed
items.desc: Under the right conditions, this will grow into a majestic Logtree over time.

items.name: Sawgrass Seed
items.desc: If planted in the right type of soil, this will sprout into a lovely Sawgrass plant.

items.name: Flatboulder
items.desc: This looks heavy. Turns out, it is.

items.name: Flatstone Gravel
items.desc: This will be incredibly useful for whatever you might use an ordinary pile of small rocks for.

items.name: Pickaxe
items.desc: Tier 1 pickaxe. This pickaxe will break through even the toughest of Flatstone Boulders! Or at least the weakest ones.

items.name: Sawgrass Sword
items.desc: Level 1 Sword. A sword made of grass. This will end well for you.

items.name: Stonahawk
items.desc: Level 5 Axe. You once read about this in a National Geographic. It seems effective.

items.name: Wompit Bone
items.desc: It can handle a lot of stress and weight, but it can't handle criticism.

items.name: Flatstone Floor
items.desc: A resilient flooring for those with finer taste.

items.name: Golden Chest
items.desc: Made of the finest-quality, gold-colored something-or-other. Probably needs a key to open!

items.name: Elixir of Scorching
items.desc: Pouring this along the murdery part of your weapon makes it RED-HOT! 3% chance to set enemies on fire upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Mild HP Potion
items.desc: Chugging one of these will make you feel as calm as a summer breeze. Restores 453 HP.

items.name: Warp Beacon
items.desc: Placing this beacon on the ground will allow you to warp to it from your map if you are within range.

items.name: Telepad
items.desc: Hewgodooko left this lying around. What an idiot!

items.name: Whistleroot
items.desc: This plant makes hilarious squealing noises as the wind blows through it. Each plant makes a unique pitch!

items.name: Whistle Borer
items.desc: This termite-like creature is attracted to the sounds of Whistleroot plants. Its jaws are razor-sharp, but it refuses to bite you.

items.name: Whistleroot Reed
items.desc: This reed is long and hollow. It's very resistant to bending, but it's not resistant to your charm and good looks. What up, reed?

items.name: Glidopus Siphon
items.desc: It's strong and rubbery, like an old garden hose. Or maybe like a new one, if it were a strong and rubbery new one.

items.name: Glidopus Ink
items.desc: Glidopi keep their ink in glass bottles for safety. A gasoline-like aroma fills the air when you pop the cork.

items.name: Gravestone
items.desc: Resurrect In Peace.

items.name: Wompit Toenail
items.desc: This toenail is tough and rough. It also tastes pretty bad, but in a good kind of way.

items.name: Intact Wompit Heart
items.desc: The heart continues pumping long after it has been torn from its host. Interesting and morbid!

items.name: Wompit Leather
items.desc: You've managed to kill a wompit and steal its skin. Hopefully you have a good reason for this kind of rude behavior.

items.name: Wooden Chair
items.desc: If you had knees, this would be a good place to sit. But still... nice to look at.

items.name: Wooden Table
items.desc: Tables: you can put things on them, so long as you use a coaster.

items.name: Old Man Statue
items.desc: His majestic moustache is sure to bring good fortune to anyone who strokes it gently.

items.name: Basic Glue
items.desc: It's sticky, like glue should be.

items.name: Chemworks
items.desc: It takes a lot of chemicals to work with all these crazy materials. This should do the trick!

items.name: Glutterfly Chitin
items.desc: It's extremely tough and hard to pronounce. But it catches the light in a really awesome way!

items.name: Glorch
items.desc: It's about time you went green with your lighting.

items.name: Glow Juice
items.desc: It seems to glow brighter in higher densities. Poking your finger into it burns and tingles at the same time.

items.name: Wompvest
items.desc: Level 3 chestplate. If you plan to run a marathon, be sure to bring tape.

items.name: Wompants
items.desc: Level 3 boots. These leggings really show off your better features.

items.name: Wompigloves
items.desc: Level 3 gloves. Nothing warms your hands up like the skin of animals!

items.name: Gunpowda
items.desc: This would be even more useful if you had a gun.

items.name: Gravelbomb
items.desc: This bomb packs quite a punch. A PUNCH IN THE NECK! Deals 200% of your DPS as physical damage.

items.name: Sawgrass Seedbomb
items.desc: Nothing's sharper than sawgrass... except maybe a sawgrass seed flying into your eye. Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.

items.name: Logtree Seedbomb
items.desc: Why plant seeds in the ground when you can plant them in FACES? Deals 125% of your DPS as physical damage.

items.name: Hearth
items.desc: It's warm and delightful. If only you had some hot cocoa to dip your toes into.

items.name: Harvestbomb
items.desc: Chop down sawgrass, logtrees, and whistleroot. WITH THE POWER OF VIOLENCE! Breaks apart Sawgrass, Logtrees, and Whistleroots!

items.name: Wooden Poledoor
items.desc: Doors make better doors than walls.

items.name: Thatched Sawfloor
items.desc: Floors prevent wild creatures from randomly popping up in your house, and can also be used as bridges!

items.name: Stone Creature Bed
items.desc: Provide all the creature comforts your creatures deserve. Comes with a name tag!

items.name: Water Pump
items.desc: This pump will produce an endless supply of water balloons when placed in Savanna water.

items.name: Water Balloon
items.desc: It squeaks annoyingly when you rub your hands all over it.

items.name: Gem Lamp
items.desc: Only the most fashionable and wealthy survivors can afford the luxury of Gem Lamps.

items.name: Yellow Gem
items.desc: If you hold it up to your eye and squint really hard, you become self conscious and immediately stop.

items.name: Wompit Garter
items.desc: Wompits love wearing decorative garters on their slender legs. Embiggens your Wompit to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Stunning Mirror
items.desc: Temporarily stun your opponents for 2 seconds by hitting them directly in the face with this fashionable mirror!

items.name: Elixir of Fireproofing
items.desc: OH GOD IT'S SO COLD WHY IS IT SO COLD GET IT AWAY. Reduces fire damage taken by 15%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Leather Ball
items.desc: Playing with leathery balls has been a pastime of your people for millennia. Why break with tradition?

items.name: Safety Gogs
items.desc: Supreme suction elongates the optical nerve, allowing you to crit like a champ! Increases critical strike chance by 10%!

items.name: Blo-Pipe
items.desc: A hefty suck'n'blow will get you to where you want to go! Assuming where you want to go is POISONING YOUR ENEMIES FOR 100% OF YOUR DPS!

items.name: Scarecrow
items.desc: Unfortunately there are no crows on this planet, so this item is probably useless. Still, it looks totally rad.

items.name: Chelm
items.desc: Level 5 helm. Like a helmet, but with a little more pizazz.

items.name: Charmor
items.desc: Level 5 chestplate. Big shoulders make you more impressive in meetings and on the go.

items.name: Choots
items.desc: Level 5 boots. Somehow you feel your knitting recipe flew off the rails.

items.name: Chittens
items.desc: Level 5 gloves. Solid as the carapace of a dead bug and with extra gripping strength to match.

items.name: Walker Blossom
items.desc: This fragrant blossom can be picked from walkerroots. When shoved into your eye, it burns immensely.

items.name: Walkerroot
items.desc: These plants look like they're trying to escape, but they're not fooling anyone.

items.name: Foliage Sign
items.desc: Slap one of these in a patch of rare vegetation to remember where it is!

items.name: Critter Sign
items.desc: If you find an important critter, slap this bad boy down as a reminder.

items.name: Water Sign
items.desc: Need to remember the location of something wet and slippery? Use this!

items.name: Blastique
items.desc: This initially soft substance becomes extremely hard over time.

items.name: Glidopus Beak
items.desc: Glidopi hide their beaks deep within their stomachs, or something. Honestly, the purpose of this thing is a mystery.

items.name: Blastique Saw
items.desc: Tier 2 saw. The serrated Blastique edges of this saw will tear through Squee plants like a knife through something soft and buttery!

items.name: Dusk Crystal
items.desc: This crystal looks totally awesome, and tastes salty sweet. It's possible that it's made of sugar. Or salt. They look very similar.

items.name: Dusk Shard
items.desc: A perfect shard of a dusk crystal. It has the majestic aura of a skateboarding dog.

items.name: Dusk Dust
items.desc: This is the byproduct of your weak attempts at harvesting dusk shards. If you suck it into your nose, it makes your pupils dilate.

items.name: Squee
items.desc: Slapping it creates a hollow drum sound. With enough of these, you could form a genuine hippie commune.

items.name: Squee Husk
items.desc: The beautiful, yet oddly rigid, husk of a Squee plant. Rubbing your fingers over it produces a pleasing sensation. Maybe a little too pleasing...

items.name: Squee Barrel
items.desc: When you squeeze it, a milky substance comes out. When you lick the milky substance, you are filled with regret.

items.name: Crystallized Juice
items.desc: An extremely potent and versatile energy source!

items.name: Giant Fossilized Skull
items.desc: The tusks on this skull indicate that the beast it once belonged to had tusks.

items.name: Giant Fossilized Femur
items.desc: You wonder what this leg bone would have been connected to. Probably something giant.

items.name: Mild Speed Potion
items.desc: This will go STRAIGHT to your thighs.

items.name: Crystal Flare
items.desc: In the darkest of times, this ornate device will keep your surroundings illuminated. In the brightest of times, it's completely useless.

items.name: Potted Baconweed
items.desc: Legend says if you leave a potted baconweed by your back step, the baconweed fairy will steal your teeth. But that's silly... isn't it?

items.name: Wompit Milk
items.desc: With the right attitude, you can milk just about anything. This comes from a domesticated Wompit!

items.name: Glutterfly Wingdust
items.desc: Carefully harvested from the furiously flapping wings of a domesticated Glutterfly. The dust gets all over everything and is very hard to get out.

items.name: Simple Ledger
items.desc: Give this to a creature to teach him basic banking skills! A banker creature will sometimes produce useful things for you.

items.name: Tartil Pitch
items.desc: A sticky ball of Tartil chunks. It tastes slightly of almonds and sweetened condensed milk. Slightly buttery. Would definitely make a great pound cake.

items.name: Tartil Tongue
items.desc: It's covered with bumps that ooze a putrid substance when popped. Still, as with bubble wrap, it's hard to resist.

items.name: Petrified Amber
items.desc: These ancient amber chunks are found in the bodies of Tartils. You can see tiny bugs trapped inside.

items.name: Stone Table
items.desc: Show your dinner guests your hard side with this solid stone table.

items.name: Stone Stool
items.desc: It's a bit firm to sit on, but oddly comfortable for very short periods of time.

items.name: Squee Seed
items.desc: With enough love and care, you can cultivate your very own Squee garden!

items.name: Squocoon
items.desc: This cocoon was found inside a Squee plant. It jiggles and bounces to the sound of music.

items.name: Straddlebark
items.desc: This plant has no roots, but the bottom is extremely sticky and hard to detach from things once it latches on.

items.name: Gassak
items.desc: This pungent-smelling plant grows in patches. It produces bags of a strange gas.

items.name: Night Glotus
items.desc: Every day it grows a new batch of glowing berries, and it opens up at night. The berries are so glowy that they're visible from space!

items.name: Bulbi
items.desc: A small and fragile plant with a single bulb. Even though it's just a plant, it seems terrified of everything.

items.name: Gassak Gas Sack
items.desc: Picked from a Gassak plant, this bubbly sack smells strongly of methane.

items.name: Glotus Berries
items.desc: These bioluminescent berries are warm to the touch and emit a deep humming sound.

items.name: Gassak Doublesack
items.desc: Two gassak sacks fused together, presumably at the hip. They're inseparable.

items.name: Gassakmeister
items.desc: This little bug seems to feed on the gas produced inside Gassak Gas Sacks. It looks sad that you have destroyed its home and family.

items.name: Tartil Firedamp
items.desc: This extremely volatile compound is produced in the belly of a domesticated Tartil. It must be extracted very carefully.

items.name: Glidopus Larva
items.desc: If you treat a domesticated Glidopus well, it will give you its firstborn. And every born after that.

items.name: Wat Wing
items.desc: Wat kind of a wing, is this? Yes, it is a Wat kind of a wing. It never stops vibrating. Wat.

items.name: Watfinger
items.desc: The fingers of a Wat are renowned for their deliciousness when fried in butter and chocolate. They're also great for flicking things in the eye!

items.name: Wat Fur Tuft
items.desc: You've carefully extracted this fur from the face of a Wat by stabbing it to death. It better be worth it!

items.name: Wuano
items.desc: This appears to be poop from a domesticated Wat. It is gross. You are gross.

items.name: Squathe
items.desc: This workstation can handle all kinds of abuse! And it spins!

items.name: Squest
items.desc: Level 7 chestplate. Sometimes you feel like a stud. This is one of those times.

items.name: Squittens
items.desc: Level 7 gloves. The palms are covered with a super sticky gripping surface.

items.name: Squaps
items.desc: Level 7 boots. They're so tight you can see your rippling calves through the material.

items.name: Squask
items.desc: Level 7 helm. This complete covering will keep your head jelly intact.

items.name: Squee Flooring
items.desc: Super absorbant and pleasing to the touch, Squee flooring can make a house out of even the dankest of dungeons!

items.name: SqueeBop
items.desc: Level 7 Hammer. Filling Squee barrels with Blastique makes for an incredibly unwieldy hammer. Fortunately, that's just your style.

items.name: Beakbone
items.desc: Level 8 Sword. With the power of ancient fossils and super sharp beaks, MOSTLY NOTHING CAN STOP YOU!

items.name: Savanna Fishing
items.desc: This flurry of fish is easily frightened.

items.name: Basic Fishing Pole
items.desc: Tier 1 fishing pole. Tempt fish into the clutches of your shiny, deadly hook!

items.name: Deviltailed Slapper
items.desc: It seems to be giving you the evil eye.

items.name: Fatheaded Slurper
items.desc: Its head is jiggly and full of some kind of squishy substance. It looks concerned about this. Restores 436 HP.

items.name: Pond Shoot
items.desc: Just a regular old piece of alien seaweed. It's extremely fibrous and tough.

items.name: Ball Snail
items.desc: It has one slimy appendage that occasionally pokes out from its shell to probe things... And it smells like potpourri.

items.name: Thatched Wall
items.desc: Perfect for keeping the baddies away!

items.name: Wobblygong
items.desc: Level 11 Axe. It's not happy about being caught, but you might as well beat things with it.

items.name: Kibweed
items.desc: The local creatures are fascinated by this little plant.

items.name: Nitro
items.desc: This compound burns your hand when you touch it. It also explodes when you touch it. Basically, don't touch it.

items.name: Glidopus Love Balloon
items.desc: This perfect replica of a Glidopus should easily trick any reasonable Glidopus. Embiggens your Glidopus to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Tartil Barrel
items.desc: This barrel is JUUUUST big enough to impress a Tartil of any size. Embiggens your Tartil to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Sea Rope
items.desc: With the power of weeds, you can tether anything to anything!

items.name: Pearl Scale
items.desc: Tough as snails and extremely shiny. You can think of some attractive people back home who wouldn't mind having some of this.

items.name: Firecracker
items.desc: Set everyone and everything on fire! Why? SHUT UP! Deals 200% of your DPS as a mixture of fire and physical damage.

items.name: Poison Bomb
items.desc: Nothing like the smell of putrid, deadly gases to get you under your desk in the morning. Deals 250% of your DPS as a mixture of poison and physical damage.

items.name: Davy Lamp
items.desc: With this beautiful, ornate lamp at your side, you suddenly feel less afraid of fire. Grants +20% fire resistance.

items.name: Flamethrower
items.desc: There's nothing quite like the smell of burning in the any time of day or night. Deals 100% of your DPS as fire damage in an area.

items.name: Stony Antidote
items.desc: It tastes of cashews. Also cleanses 1,378 poison from your body.

items.name: Stony Burn Salve
items.desc: Rub this bad boy all over your tender skin! It'll clear up 1,378 burn damage.

items.name: Elixir of Luminescence
items.desc: Rubbing this into your fleshy bod gives it a healthy glow! Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Fish Food
items.desc: Placing this delicious treat in Savanna water will attract a new school of fish!

items.name: Stony Health Potion
items.desc: Made from the finest fatheads, this potion will cure what ails you, so long as what ails you is near-death. Restores 638 HP.

items.name: Pearlscale Sword
items.desc: Level 9 Sword. Its hooked shape is inspired by its origins!

items.name: Pearlhat
items.desc: Level 9 helm. Pointy, tough, and royal as F... fish.

items.name: Pearlpants
items.desc: Level 9 boots. Their shiny sheen really brings out the definition in your thighs.

items.name: Pearlgloves
items.desc: Level 9 gloves. Your hands have never been so scaly.

items.name: Pearlplate
items.desc: Level 9 chestplate. It protects your sternum from pokes, and it looks fabulous, too!

items.name: The Butterfly
items.desc: Level 11 legendary Axe. A lot of time, love, blood, sweat, and amber went into this. WORTH IT.

items.name: Wooden Chest
items.desc: WOOD CHEST IS GOOD CHEST.

items.name: Hat Rack
items.desc: It's way too perfectly spherical to possibly fit a hat on. Still, it looks GREAT!

items.name: Stone Bed
items.desc: A fine place for a quick snooze. Legends say that while you're asleep, all of your health is restored.

items.name: Zug Shell
items.desc: It seems you can carefully pry the tough, outer shell off a Zug by stabbing it or beating it to death. SCIENCEY!

items.name: Zug Sparkplug
items.desc: When Zuglings are approaching maturity, they build their own sparkplugs by hand, and then surgically insert them into their own shells. It's a cultural rite of passage type thing. You wouldn't understand.

items.name: Zug Kneecap
items.desc: Zugs have incredibly sophisticated kneecaps, rivaling the technology of a whole bunch of other stuff, like human kneecaps.

items.name: Charged Zug Molt
items.desc: When a domesticated Zug is overfed, it has to shed its skin. It shocks you every time you touch it!

items.name: Shellfinger Pick
items.desc: Tier 2 pickaxe. Jamming a Wat finger into a Zug shell seemed like a good idea at the time. AND IT STILL DOES! This thing can break through Dusk crystals!

items.name: Crystal Kiln
items.desc: Dusk Crystals can withstand a tremendous amount of heat, which makes them perfect for CONTAINING TREMENDOUS AMOUNTS OF HEAT!

items.name: Dusk Prism
items.desc: When hammered into a triangular shape and infused with the souls of Glidopus babies, Dusk Crystals sure make one heck of a prism!

items.name: Teleporter Mk1
items.desc: A shoddily-built teleporter with a fairly medium range. Still, a few of these strung together should make for a nice teleporter network!

items.name: ZuglaBall
items.desc: Zugs are attracted by the allure of anything electrical. This Tesla ball is sure to impress! Embiggens your Zug to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Wat Bat
items.desc: Wats are renowned for their love of sports! Embiggens your Wat to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Dusk Seed
items.desc: By combining a Dusk crystal with some other odds and ends, you've been able to seed the growth of a Dusk Crystal formation!

items.name: Writable Sign
items.desc: A sign you can write on! With this, you can label areas on your map. IT'S REVOLUTIONARY!

items.name: Elixir of Bulging Biceps
items.desc: Everybody knows that the bigger your biceps, the harder you hit stuff. Improves damage dealt by 5%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Crystal Floor
items.desc: It's one of the toughest and rarest materials in the Savanna. So... what better way to use a Dusk Crystal than to WALK ALL OVER IT?

items.name: Crystal Axe
items.desc: Level 11 Axe. Dusk Crystals are extremely sharp when broken up into pieces. Makes for a great STAB!

items.name: Duskhelm
items.desc: Level 11 helm. The sparkplugs energize your brain and help you to think more clearly!

items.name: Duskjacket
items.desc: Level 11 chestplate. The crystal creates a nice, reflective surface that really accentuates your curves.

items.name: Duskpants
items.desc: Level 11 pants. They're pretty stiff, but you figure you'll make it work.

items.name: Duskmitts
items.desc: Level 11 gloves. The extra layer of Wat fur really helps keep your sensitive elbows warm!

items.name: Crystal Wall
items.desc: These crystalline walls are very... ACOUSTIC. You can hear your own voice echoing back when you're near them.

items.name: Crystal Door
items.desc: Square doors make for a better seal, but KEEP AN EYE OUT FOR YOUR SHINS.

items.name: Potted Kibweed
items.desc: It's always good to maintain a self-replenishing stock of Kibweed to keep your creatures happy.

items.name: Potted Sunshroom
items.desc: Be sure to keep it in a shady place! Ah, who am I kidding? There is no shade on this planet. Put it wherever you want.

items.name: Potted Bulbi
items.desc: It's always good to keep a stockpile of Bulbi around. You know... for medicinal purposes.

items.name: Glorb
items.desc: You can take it as well as you can dish it out! Provides 5% chance to poison enemies and 5% poison resistance.

items.name: Anger Omelet
items.desc: Your pets will love the spicy deliciousness so much, they'll go into a murderous rampage! 15% pet damage boost for 20 minutes.

items.name: Potted Bumpberry
items.desc: Bumpberries are pretty rare. It'd be a good idea to keep a few pots of them around!

items.name: Blegh
items.desc: The pods grown on this fork-shaped plant are full of an aromatic goo that burns like crazy when you rub it all over yourself.

items.name: Artree
items.desc: Although it looks like a plant, the Artree is definitely connected to the vascular system of the Bawg.

items.name: Clossom
items.desc: Some kind of hybrid between a living claw and an Agave-like plant, this taco-meat-flavored organism may very well restore 1,560 HP.

items.name: Thrombyte
items.desc: This large blister is JAM-PACKED full of a succulent fluid! It'll take a lot of vigorous pumping to get it all out.

items.name: Pyn
items.desc: This parasitic creature feeds on the life force of the Bawg. TIME FOR PAYBACK! Restores 2,234 HP when eaten.

items.name: Bloo
items.desc: Whenever you stand near a Jollychomp with one of these tick-like creatures in hand, the Jollychomp seems very interested.

items.name: Bone Spur
items.desc: These spurs appear to be quite painful to the Bawg. You'd be doing it a favor by removing them.

items.name: Nurva
items.desc: Nurva are the dendrites of neurons that have somehow managed to protrude from the flesh of the Bawg. They crackle with electricity!

items.name: Bawg Hair
items.desc: Just a regular, ordinary, person-sized strand of hair.

items.name: Tuber
items.desc: These plants grow deep within the tissue of the Bawg. In many ways, they're a lot like potatoes. In many other ways, they're absolutely nothing like potatoes.

items.name: Pikkaye
items.desc: This fingery creature/plant repeatedly grows bulbous red pustules that taste a bit like cherries. It flinches when you pick them.

items.name: Giantbone Helm
items.desc: Level 12 Helm. After painstakingly finding the sturdiest giant skull around, you've assembled what many would consider to be... a fantastic hat.

items.name: Splinter
items.desc: This large fragment of matter can be found firmly lodged in the flesh of the Bawg. Removing splinters seems to make the Bawg very happy.

items.name: Tusker
items.desc: This little growth is absolutely bursting with fruity flavors. MMMMM! Restores 591 HP.

items.name: Jollychomp
items.desc: These smiley little guys like to hang out in groups, and they're always hungry. If you feed them, they give you something in return!

items.name: Satgat Exoskeleton
items.desc: After being forcibly removed from a Satgat's body, the exoskeleton glows for a while and makes loud humming noises. It makes you very uncomfortable.

items.name: Satgat Chemoreceptors
items.desc: If you touch both ends of it to your tongue, it shocks you. But it tastes really good, so it's probably worth it.

items.name: Satgat Silk
items.desc: Harvested from the silkparts of a domesticated Satgat. It's so ridiculously soft, you could probably make a very expensive pair of underpants from it!

items.name: Satgat Flesh
items.desc: Although Satgats have very hard shells, their flesh is soft and tender. Like a clam, only more adorable.

items.name: Snorble Airsak
items.desc: When you squeeze it, it lets out a dramatically loud, fart-like sound. This would work well for pranks, if you weren't the only human on this entire planet.

items.name: Snorble Mucusak
items.desc: Snorbles use these as a form of currency. If you treat a domesticated Snorble well, it might give you one!

items.name: Snorble Skin
items.desc: It's really rough on one side, but on the other side it's gross and wet. This is bit of a no-win situation, really.

items.name: Snorble Uvula
items.desc: The Snorble's uvula is a very delicate thing, because it contains the Snorble's third brain stem. It shies away from you when you try to poke it with a stick.

items.name: Throak Fluoros
items.desc: This sticky substance is extremely smelly, and it would probably kill you if you covered yourself with it and set yourself on fire.

items.name: Throak Jelly
items.desc: This ball of goo was extracted from the body of a domesticated Throak. It wobbles perpetually without stopping!

items.name: Throak Nematocyte
items.desc: This enlarged cell body contains a huge volume of chemicals that can be used to freeze things, slowing them down tremendously. If you lick it, your tongue freezes to it.

items.name: Throak Polyp
items.desc: This seems to be the baby version of a Throak. It's not very adorable.

items.name: Throak Tentacle
items.desc: It seems to stay alive even when separated from the Throak's body. It's almost as if it's an entirely separate creature.

items.name: Jolly Gastrolith
items.desc: Jollychomps eat these hard stones and use them to grind up whatever they eat. They even use the stones to somehow convert food into other useful materials!

items.name: Jolly Fulmar
items.desc: Jollies are capable of spitting these balls of sticky, disgusting goo at predators to keep them away. It rarely works.

items.name: Jollybab
items.desc: This tiny Jollychomp appears to be a baby. They must somehow lose their eyes when they reach adulthood. This makes no sense, but it must work for them.

items.name: Jolly
items.desc: This tasty treat is belched out of the mouth of a Jollychomp under the right conditions. It smells and tastes fruity-licious!

items.name: Thrombyte Fibrin
items.desc: Powering up your Thrombopump with a few components from the Bawg allows you to extract these tough fibers. Salty!

items.name: Extracted Tuber
items.desc: This little creature grows out of the enlarged pores of the Bawg. It doesn't seem happy to be removed from its home, but you obviously don't care.

items.name: Luminalgae
items.desc: This plant-like organism somehow thrives in the acidic pools of the Bawg. It turns the acid into a bioluminescent glow, which it uses to lure in unsuspecting Plonktans to eat.

items.name: Coral Tubes
items.desc: Tiny creatures are living inside these tubes. They don't like being out of the Bawg's acid, but you don't really care.

items.name: Skeletonized Fathead
items.desc: The acid of the Bawg has purified the healing essence of this Fathead. Restores 2,234 HP!

items.name: Vampry
items.desc: Vampries attach themselves onto anything that dips its toe into the water. Their barbed teeth make them very difficult to pry off. Fortunately, they're ticklish.

items.name: Plonktan
items.desc: This enormous tiny sea creature just floats around and gets eaten by things. It has a very stupid life.

items.name: Nurvaxon
items.desc: The long, slender axon of a Nurva. It conducts electricity really well, but it's terrible at baking cakes.

items.name: Dendrite Spine
items.desc: This projection of a Nurva is used to poke the eyes of things that wander nearby. As you look closer at it, it pokes you in the eye. You're not sure what you expected.

items.name: Myelar
items.desc: This styrofoam-like tissue can be ripped from Nurvas, and it makes for great electrical insulation!

items.name: Nurva Seed
items.desc: This little pod can be jammed into the flesh of the Bawg to grow new Nurva. It's odd when you think about it, so you stop thinking about it.

items.name: Jackagong
items.desc: Level 21 Axe. You aren't sure which end to hold this thing by. It's pretty pointy no matter how you approach it.

items.name: Bamstache
items.desc: The legendary moustache of a Bamli. When you peer into it, you can see your own soul reflected back at you.

items.name: Bamli Horn
items.desc: You removed this horn forcibly from a Bamli's head. It was pretty horrifying. You're a monster.

items.name: Bamli Flightbladder
items.desc: To aid in flight, the Bamli inflates its Flightbladder with absolutely nothing. Once the bladder is inflated, the Bamli becomes buoyant in the air and soars like a majestic eagle.

items.name: Painsulin
items.desc: The domesticated Bamli produces an excessive amount of this hormone. It's unclear what it's for.

items.name: Vompole
items.desc: An unexploded Vomma baby. It adorably tries to tear your arm off whenever you pet it. Babies are so cute.

items.name: Vlap
items.desc: Vomma are covered with these fleshy flaps. Their primary purpose seems to be for decoration. Lady Vommas love a man with big flaps.

items.name: Boba
items.desc: Domesticated Vomma produce these tasty balls of gelatin on a regular basis. They remind you a lot of tapioka.

items.name: Vomma Babymaker
items.desc: This is where Vomma babies are made. You're not sure why you felt compelled to pick it up and carry it around.

items.name: Bawg Fishing
items.desc: Something is moving around under all that acid...

items.name: Blube
items.desc: This tube carries a blue liquid around inside the Bawg. It's really stretchy and rubbery. You could probably whip something really hard with it!

items.name: Blood Louse
items.desc: This little guy latches onto Blubes and drinks the blood of the Bawg. It's pretty gross, but he doesn't seem too concerned.

items.name: Sagtatoe
items.desc: Plucked from the branches of an Artree, this potato-shaped saggy sack seems to be full of fat.

items.name: Artree Seed
items.desc: By plunging this into the Bawg's flesh, you can foster the growth of new Artrees. Which you can then stab repeatedly with sharp tools.

items.name: Bleghpod
items.desc: After prying this from the clutches of a vicious Blegh, you are able to examine it up-close. You have concluded that it is bumpy.

items.name: Hairbark
items.desc: Much like the bark of a tree, the bark of the Bawg's gigantic hairs is tough and dry. It appears to be flammable, but it would probably smell terrible to burn it.

items.name: Split End
items.desc: The Bawg has apparently never heard of conditioner.

items.name: Ayeayes
items.desc: This was given to you by a friendly Pikkaye. Yes, that's right. Given.

items.name: Hair Louse
items.desc: This thing was burrowed deep inside a giant hair. It makes you feel itchy just looking at it.

items.name: Spur Gold
items.desc: Somehow, those giant spurs sticking out of the Bawg are able to develop gold chunks inside of them. You should investigate this further, for science.

items.name: Grenamel
items.desc: You were able to break this off of a spur. It's a very tough, shell-like thing, and it's super shiny. It would look cool to have a car made of this.

items.name: Spur Gum
items.desc: You managed to tear this off the foundation of a Spur before you destroyed it. Kind of like a dentist.

items.name: Wojack Cilia
items.desc: This must be how the Wojacks get around underground. It won't stop wiggling around.

items.name: Wojack Cornea
items.desc: Although Wojacks spend a lot of time undergound, they appear to have very sophisticated eyeballs.

items.name: Wojack Petal
items.desc: Is it a tooth, claw, horn, or flower petal? The world may never know. But it smells delightful.

items.name: Wojack Spice
items.desc: This came out of a domesticated Wojacks's... spice... organ. When you sniff it, your eyes change color.

items.name: Wojack Sucker
items.desc: The severed arm of a Wojack. It wasn't really using it, anyway.

items.name: Dusk Trowel
items.desc: Tier 1 trowel. This trowel should come in handy for POPPING plants and stubborn organisms out of the ground!

items.name: Clikkax
items.desc: Tier 3 pickaxe. This pickaxe is insanely sturdy, for being made out of tentacles and plants!

items.name: Sawstache
items.desc: Tier 4 saw. The moustache of a Bamli is so rugged and manly that you can cut down Bonespurs and Hairbark with it! And lots of other stuff, too!

items.name: Exopole
items.desc: Tier 2 fishing pole. This pole is made of the most resilient materials of the Bawg, so it should DEFINITELY be able to stand up to a little bit of acid.

items.name: Jacksaw
items.desc: Tier 3 saw. The flora of the Bawg seem very resilient to your masterfully crafted Blastique saw, but this puppy should do the trick.

items.name: Waterbomb
items.desc: By jamming a reed into a water balloon, you're now able to fling it with TREMENDOUS FORCE onto your seeds! Seeds love that kinda stuff, right?

items.name: Ship Door
items.desc: It's a door from your ship!

items.name: Ship Wall
items.desc: It's a wall from your ship!

items.name: Communication Console
items.desc: This is how you talk with the Bureau of Shipping.

items.name: Whizbox Container
items.desc: It's where you get your Whizbox!

items.name: Whizbox
items.desc: Your trusty companion OF SCIENCE!

items.name: Broken Console
items.desc: This communications console has broken down and is now VERY DANGEROUS!

items.name: Space Wrench
items.desc: This is great for clearing broken ship parts, and for stunning creatures at a distance!

items.name: Broken Ship Door
items.desc: This door has broken down, and it's now shooting electricity everywhere!

items.name: Damaged Ship Wall
items.desc: A wall from your ship. It has been heavily damaged.

items.name: Lander
items.desc: Your lander.

items.name: The G-Gnome
items.desc: He seems to be staring into your soul with his cold, lifeless eyes.

items.name: Ship Lanturn
items.desc: This keeps your ship illuminated!

items.name: Ship Engine
items.desc: The engines that power the B.S. S.S. Assess.

items.name: Compendium
items.desc: This is how you keep track of your science!

items.name: Ship Respawner
items.desc: This beacon allows you to come back to life on the B.S. S.S. Assess.

items.name: Vlammer
items.desc: Level 13 Hammer. When combined with the power of Vlaps, Jollychomp parts make for an excellent beating device.

items.name: Petalprod
items.desc: Level 15 Sword. The petals of a wojack are extraordinarily pointy. You find that when you shove them into things, it hurts a lot.

items.name: Tentaclax
items.desc: Level 17 Axe. You might think something like a floppy tentacle would make for a terrible axe. You might think WRONG.

items.name: Sakslapper
items.desc: Level 19 Hammer. It's about time you gave those Snorbles a taste of their own saks.

items.name: Exord
items.desc: Level 21 Sword. This intuitively effective weapon can slice through even the mightiest of... Well, all kinds of stuff, really.

items.name: Grumbler
items.desc: Level 23 Axe. By harnessing the power of the Bamli, you've managed to assemble an axe that can strike down ALL WHO STAND BEFORE YOU! Almost.

items.name: Bambukket
items.desc: For some reason, Bamlis have an unnatural obsession with anything shaped like a bucket. Embiggens your Bamli to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Leather Throwpillow
items.desc: This leathery pillow will really tie the room together!

items.name: Glow Pillow
items.desc: Not only does it look super comfortable, it also emits an eerie glow that makes you feel queasy!

items.name: Blue Throwpillow
items.desc: Something about the color of this pillow makes you feel insightful and creative.

items.name: Inked Throwpillow
items.desc: You get a sense that having this pillow around will make you feel ultra hip, or whatever the kids are saying these days.

items.name: Stuffed Wompit
items.desc: After spending so much time around wompits, you're able to perfectly recreate a Wompit using your skills of taxidermy!

items.name: Stuffed Glidopus
items.desc: This lifelike dead Glidopus will either spruce up your living room, or something resembling the exact opposite.

items.name: Stuffed Glutterfly
items.desc: If you strategically place this stuffed Glutterfly somewhere, it would look creepy.

items.name: Leather Bagchair
items.desc: This would be really comfortable to sit in if you had knees.

items.name: Inked Bagchair
items.desc: This darkened bagchair is sure to attract... nothing, actually. You're the only person on this planet. But dang, does this bagchair look good.

items.name: Glowy Bagchair
items.desc: It's possible that sitting on this chair will cause certain parts of your body to become radioactive. RADIOACTIVELY AWESOME, THAT IS.

items.name: Bluebag Chair
items.desc: It took a lot of walker blossoms to make this, but you reassure yourself that it was totally worth it somehow.

items.name: Bureau Scroll
items.desc: With the power of WRITING ON WOOD PULP, you are now able to convey your love toward the Bureau of Shipping. Great job!

items.name: Armvlaps
items.desc: Level 13 Glove. Wrapping your hands in the loving Vlaps of a Vomma makes you feel warm, safe, and secure.

items.name: Vlest
items.desc: Level 13 Chest. You feel warm and cuddly when you wrap yourself in a majestic suit of Vlaps.

items.name: Vlapchaps
items.desc: Level 13 Pants. These chaps are exposed in the back, allowing you to enjoy a nice, cool breeze.

items.name: Vlapface Hat
items.desc: Level 13 Helm. You think this hat makes you look super awesome. You might be right about that, but you might not.

items.name: Jollyscope
items.desc: Using the focused power of firmified Jolly Fulmar, you're able to finely craft things with such immense detail that it hurts your eye sockets just thinking about it.

items.name: Fauxsack
items.desc: Deploying this fake Vomma Baby Sack causes something magical to happen! Embiggens your Vomma to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Siphon Floor
items.desc: This floor makes an awkward squishing noise as you rub your toes against it, but it feels nice.

items.name: Chitin Floor
items.desc: The shiny sheen of this floor makes you want to roll around on it, so you might as well.

items.name: Bone Floor
items.desc: There's nothing quite like the bones of a thousand alien cow hippos to really add spice to a room.

items.name: Stone Chest
items.desc: This amazing-looking chest will hold whatever you put in it! Except love. Nothing can contain love.

items.name: Throak Headguard
items.desc: Level 17 Helm. Looking at this helm makes you wonder if you'll ever be able to get it off. Good thing it's stylish, or you'd be concerned.

items.name: Tentavest
items.desc: Level 17 Chest. The suckers of the Throak tentacles constantly give you backrubs. It's nice.

items.name: Coiled Tentagloves
items.desc: Level 17 Glove. The tentacles respond to your movements and make you feel way stronger and 30% more awesome.

items.name: Tentaclaps
items.desc: Level 17 Pants. By attaching cilia to the bottom of your feet, you feel like you're gliding along the ground. You're not, but... it definitely feels like it.

items.name: Myelar Faceholder
items.desc: Level 15 Helm. The insulating nature of Myelar keeps your face toasty warm, like a marshmallow being incinerated over an open flame. It's quite painful.

items.name: Myelants
items.desc: Level 15 Pants. The insides of these slippers are... slippery. When you walk, it sounds like someone chewing a mouthful of mayonnaise.

items.name: Myelirt
items.desc: Level 15 Chest. The constant flexing of the myelar makes it incredibly hard to breathe, yet you still feel compelled to wear it.

items.name: Myelar Armsheaths
items.desc: Level 15 Glove. With the power of Wojack Suckers, you can hold on to just about anything!

items.name: Bioloom
items.desc: By weaving together all kinds of spindly, slimy organs and things, you've managed to create quite the impeccable workstation!

items.name: Cauldron
items.desc: Stretched and slapped Bleghpods make for an excellent container!

items.name: Splintrowel
items.desc: Tier 2 trowel. A much more rugged trowel than its predecessor, the Splintrowel can pry just about anything out of the ground!

items.name: Thrackle
items.desc: Young Throaks often lose control of their tentacles. But not with THIS! Embiggens your Throak to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Wojack Soap
items.desc: Although they look disgusting, Wojacks are obsessed with cleanliness! Embiggens your Wojack to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Snelm
items.desc: Level 19 Helm. This will either convince your enemies that you're a snorble, or convince your enemies that you're a crazy person wearing snorble parts on your face.

items.name: Snest
items.desc: Level 19 Chest. The airsaks protect your amazing chest skin from imminent harm, and the Wojack spice exfoliates your pores. High-tech!

items.name: Snittens
items.desc: Level 19 Glove. Snorble Airsaks are velvety soft on the inside. It's like having your hand in a real glove!

items.name: Snoots
items.desc: Level 19 Pants. Your legs will thank you after being exposed to the luscious juices of the Ayeayeas... uh... berries?

items.name: Exohead Facemask
items.desc: Level 21 Helm. The sharp corners of this facemask constantly poke you in the eyes, but it's a sacrifice you have to make for fashion.

items.name: Exochest
items.desc: Level 21 Chest. Although it looks bulky, it's actually quite light. It's even aerodynamic!

items.name: Exosleeves
items.desc: Level 21 Glove. By covering your arms with Satgat exoskeletons, you've managed to look... not leaf-like whatsoever.

items.name: Exoots
items.desc: Level 21 Pants. Although pointy on the outside, the inside is soft and warm. It will protect your most important parts.

items.name: Dusky Healing Potion
items.desc: When cooked ever so slightly, Fatheads produce a delicious juice that restores 1,609 HP.

items.name: Snorbelt
items.desc: Snorbles are very safety-conscious; it's why they evolved giant airbags all over their bodies. Embiggens your Snorble to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Bleghmar Treat
items.desc: Cramming a tasty Bleghpod full of nutritious Jolly Fulmar? AMAZING! Boosts your pet's critical strike chance by 15% for 20 minutes.

items.name: Thrombopump
items.desc: By slapping this pump onto a Thrombyte, you can extract whatever goodness lies inside!

items.name: Attractive Mask
items.desc: Satgats are self-conscious about their stupid faces, so they love to find new ways to keep themselves covered! Embiggens your Satgat to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Granvil
items.desc: The moustache of a Bamli is so powerful, you can use it to BEND ANYTHING TO YOUR WILL! It's also super attractive.

items.name: Wooden Writable Sign
items.desc: You've treated this wood such that you can write and erase stuff on it! Now you can label parts of the map.

items.name: Grenoots
items.desc: Level 23 Pants. The power of ancient Bamli horn allows you to leap small things in a single bound or more! HIYOOOO!

items.name: Grenamel Stachemask
items.desc: Level 23 Helm. What's better than having a hairy face? Having a hair-barky face.

items.name: Grestplate
items.desc: Level 23 Chest. Sometimes, you just gotta awesomely cover your entire torso in the forged bones of an ancient giant beast. This is one of those times.

items.name: Grenamel Armpads
items.desc: Level 23 Glove. Grenamel makes for amazing arm protection, so long as you don't care about using your elbows, fingers, or anything else.

items.name: Karboan Healing Potion
items.desc: It's ICE COLD! Restores 52,087 HP.

items.name: Pipey Healing Potion
items.desc: It goes down smooth, like a smoooooth smoothie. Restores 125,060 HP.

items.name: Elixir of Concussions
items.desc: Drinking this brew makes you want to punch stuff! 2% chance to stun enemies upon striking per second. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Blegh Healing Potion
items.desc: Let's be honest here; you're just throwing ingredients into a jar and seeing what sticks. Restores 2,221 HP.

items.name: Elixir of Shocking
items.desc: You may think you don't need to call down lightning from the heavens... BUT YOU DO. 3% chance to shock enemies upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Grenamel Healing Potion
items.desc: As the saying goes... Sometimes you juice the louse, and sometimes the louse juices you. Restores 9,670 HP.

items.name: Sagdog
items.desc: It's a sagtatoe in a tube! But this isn't fit for human consumption, so... PET FOOD IT IS! Restores 13,407 HP to your pet.

items.name: Furgrasp
items.desc: Its long, claw-like branches often snag the fur of animals that pass by. It probably uses the fur for knitting hats.

items.name: Spiregg
items.desc: It's unclear what laid this egg. But it is clear that it's packed with nutrients and goodies, like some kind of natural pinata.

items.name: Smashblossom
items.desc: The flower of this plant is insanely heavy. The blossom climbs up the stalk, then smashes down into the ice to break off chunks, which the plant then consumes.

items.name: Geysir
items.desc: The water inside overflows until it freezes over, creating a sort of cap. One the frozen cap is in place, the Geysir builds up tremendous pressure inside that is only relieved when the cap is removed.

items.name: Tundra School
items.desc: Something is stirring under the cold, icy waters.

items.name: Ice Skate
items.desc: This flat, fish-like creature clings to ice chunks and blends in with them. It also speaks several languages, none of which you understand.

items.name: Squeti
items.desc: A hairy squid, well-suited for swimming in the extreme cold of the Tundra. It seems highly intelligent.

items.name: Ventsleeper
items.desc: This snail-like beasty lives around boiling hot-water vents deep in the bottom of the ocean. It shivers nonstop as soon as you pull it out of the water.

items.name: Coralduster
items.desc: Its bristles are soft. They remind you of the time you used to work as a maid and carried a featherduster around everywhere you went.

items.name: Bonkagong
items.desc: Level 29 Hammer. This fish has no skull. Instead, its stomach is in its head, and it swallows an exorbitant number of stones, which it keeps in its head-stomach to protect its tiny, tiny brain.

items.name: Conjoined Perp
items.desc: These plants grow in pairs, and they have a shifty attitude. It would be wise not to trust them. Restores 7,103 HP.

items.name: Hard Core
items.desc: This thing is sharp and pointy. It seems pretty hardcore.

items.name: Parapod
items.desc: When squeezed, it emits a horrible odor. You also hear rumbling sounds nearby. Restores 7,268 HP.

items.name: Bluff
items.desc: Instead of leaves, this plant grows a crazy amount of hair. The hair generates energy for the plant by blowing in the wind. It reminds you of one of your distant relatives.

items.name: Flailtree
items.desc: This tree twitches when hostile creatures come near it, but it never swings. You surmise that it might be a pacifist.

items.name: Pipedirt
items.desc: It's unclear whether this is a type of coral, a plant, an animal, or something in between. The sounds it makes as the wind blows through the pipes remind you of an old timey church organ!

items.name: Crystine
items.desc: A chunk of pristine, green crystal protruding up from the shattered crystalline area of the Tundra. It sings and vibrates when it senses you are near it.

items.name: Magmite Mound
items.desc: It's full of mites! They build the mound using blood, sweat, tears, and a little bit of elbow grease. The mound is easily popped open with a trowel, though.

items.name: Flungus
items.desc: The bags are probably full of helium or something. It floats gently above the waters of the Tundra.

items.name: Hewgodooko Wall
items.desc: One of the walls from Hewgodooko's savanna fortresses. It's pretty dang durable.

items.name: Hewgodooko Console
items.desc: One of Hewgodooko's control consoles. It's connected to something much larger than itself.

items.name: Hewgodooko Door
items.desc: WHAT'S IT MADE OF?

items.name: Icequill
items.desc: A cluster of bioluminescent algae that has adapted to only grow on ice. Your tongue sticks to it if you lick it. Restores 16,906 HP.

items.name: Coppersponge
items.desc: This plant grows perfect sponges made of copper. This will be super helpful when you have to do the dishes.

items.name: Depressurized Larva
items.desc: This larva looks like it has suffered from decompression sickness. It probably came from somewhere incredibly deep under the ground...

items.name: Fanged Strangler
items.desc: This tiny critter uses advanced elegtromagnetic-detecting neurons to find the nearest neck and strangle it. It would make a great gift for children you hate.

items.name: Boreole
items.desc: It glows between a range of colors to lure in its prey. When the target gets close, it sits there and does nothing, because it's a mushroom.

items.name: Liquideon
items.desc: Orange goo that has seeped up through the cracks in the green crystals of the Tundra. It has since hardened... And it smells like squid.

items.name: Bunnion
items.desc: Although it looks like an adorable rabbit, it's just a camouflaged root vegetable. Ignore the fact that it screams when you eat it. That's part of the camouflage. Restores 40,293 HP.

items.name: Bluffollicle
items.desc: You've managed to whack a Bluff hard enough to knock its follicle right out! It doesn't seeem physically possible, but it happened.

items.name: Bluffluff
items.desc: It's so soft, you figure the thread count on this thing is in the jillions. It would make a nice bed... or coat.

items.name: Smashblossom Pistil
items.desc: This thing appears to be used to perform unspeakable acts of plant romance.

items.name: Smashblossom Petal
items.desc: This weighs from three to twelve hundred pounds or kilograms. Or grams. It's very squirmy, so it's tough to get a read on it.

items.name: Smashblossom Trunk
items.desc: This trunk sure can take a pounding.

items.name: Emerald Smashborer
items.desc: It's pretty jittery. It can only be calmed down by the rhythmic, explosive pounding of a Smashblossom.

items.name: Flailpod
items.desc: It has a convenient grip, almost as it if was made to be thrown by you and you alone. As you gaze upon the flailpod, you feel butterflies in your stomach. It was meant to be.

items.name: Blackbark
items.desc: The blackbark of a Flailtree is much stronger and more resilient than its backbark.

items.name: Flaycorn
items.desc: The seed of a Flailtree. It's very aggressive and disagreeable. Better to bury it and get it over with.

items.name: Furgrasp Antler
items.desc: The Furgrasp uses these long, pointy appendages to rip tufts of fur from... something.

items.name: Furgrasp Foliage
items.desc: These leaves are fibrous, almost as if they were woven together by a tiny person with tiny, tiny fingers. Like a baby, or perhaps a very small monkey.

items.name: Furgrasp Seed
items.desc: After murdering its father, the least you can do is plant this seed. Don't be a barbarian.

items.name: Strange Tuft
items.desc: A furgrasp must have ripped this tuft off of something... strange...

items.name: Flungus Airoot
items.desc: Flungi use these roots to keep themselves aloft somehow. It seems like magic, so it probably is, according to Occam's razor.

items.name: Flungus Brain
items.desc: Based on the size and complexity of his brain, Flungi may be the most intelligent creatures in the universe. Too bad they can't move or speak!

items.name: Flungus Sporebee
items.desc: Flungi home in on these bees to deposit their spores, or something. Planting one of these in Furdle Frost should generate a Flungus, at any rate!

items.name: Flungus Pod
items.desc: This pod has avoided being exploded by your violent attacks. You sense that it is terrifed of you, and probably delicious.

items.name: Spiregg Goop
items.desc: It's wet and sticky, like the goop that comes out of an egg. Oh, wait... that's EXACTLY WHAT IT IS.

items.name: Spiregg Yolk
items.desc: It's packed full of nutrients, like fat, cholesterol, and various poisons! It also seems to be glaring at you.

items.name: Spiregg Shell
items.desc: This shell is one of the hardest substances you've seen since you began looking at it just a second ago.

items.name: Magmite King
items.desc: It demands that you bow before it and kiss its appendages.

items.name: Magmite Worker
items.desc: This little bugger will chop the back of your face off if you take your eyes off it for a second. Just to be safe, you should try it.

items.name: Lonsdaleite
items.desc: This substance is harder than anything you've ever seen. The Magmites build their nests around this stuff, apparently hoping to mine it. So far they have never succeeded.

items.name: Oil
items.desc: You can't imagine what this might be useful for.

items.name: Pipedirt Pipe
items.desc: This is just a pipe, made out of some type of organic plant matter. It becomes progressively floppier over time.

items.name: Rustmoss
items.desc: This mossy stuff must do something to produce the pipes you always see protruding from it. BUT WHAT? Science will never know.

items.name: Diamond
items.desc: The intense pressures inside Geysirs are SO CRAZY HIGH, they can turn just about anything into a diamond! Including whatever this was!

items.name: Geysir Slurry
items.desc: When scrubbed down, this ball of crud yields a cornucopia of precious metals!

items.name: Spood Beast
items.desc: This little weirdo can move REALLY fast. When it wants to. Which it doesn't. YOU CAN'T TELL IT WHAT TO DO.

items.name: Basic Hewgotable
items.desc: This table was built by Hewgodooko's bare hands. Or whatever he uses for this kind of thing. Lasers, probably. Bare lasers.

items.name: Basic Hewgochair
items.desc: This chair was found in one of Hewgodooko's bases. The craftsmanship is exquisite. Looking at this chair, you wonder whether Hewgodooko was once a skilled carpenter, and if so, why he would know how to build chairs if he can levitate.

items.name: Hewgolamp
items.desc: This lamp glows with infinite fuel, probably using some kind of mystical energy source known only to... whatever Hewgodooko is.

items.name: Basic Hewgochest
items.desc: Hewgodooko has some pretty big chests. This will come in handy for normal chest-based activities.

items.name: Teal Hewgolantern
items.desc: A lamp from Hewgodooko's base that goes on the floor. It glows a beautiful teal. The color reminds you of toothpaste, or the ocean, or stuff like that.

items.name: Turbo Green Hewgolantern
items.desc: This lantern is so green, you wonder if it could possibly get any greener. The answer is yes... OR IS IT? No, it's not.

items.name: Yella Hewgolantern
items.desc: This lantern is yella. Yella, like the colah of the skah on a nahce summa dah.

items.name: Rudorange Hewgolantern
items.desc: This lantern glows a deep, reddish-orange. It reminds you of the fiery eyes of a demon you once loved.

items.name: Magentamazing Hewgolantern
items.desc: THIS HEWGOLANTERN IS MAGENTAMAAAAAZING! It's magenta.

items.name: Perp Purp Hewgolantern
items.desc: The color of this lantern is similar to the prison garb of inmates back home on Earth. Those were the days.

items.name: Bluh Hewgolantern
items.desc: Dis lamp has uh bluh gluh.

items.name: Hologram
items.desc: This hologram stores a memory print of whatever the user exposes it to. Unfortunately, it's too sophisticated for your feeble mind to understand how to update the display. Still, it looks nice!

items.name: Glaser Silk
items.desc: Extracted from a domesticated Glaser, it works well to keep things tied up. Might as well not question a good thing.

items.name: Glaser Antler Fragment
items.desc: It's pointy and hums with energy. You wonder how it would feel to get poked by it.

items.name: Glaser Stomachball
items.desc: When a Glaser eats something unusual, its stomachs tie in knots. This seems like a disadvantage.

items.name: Glaser Hoof
items.desc: It's extremely well insulated, like styrofoam. It also feels like styrofoam. You wonder if it's styrofoam. It might just be styrofoam.

items.name: Glaser Chargenub
items.desc: The heart of a Glaser's extreme energy powers, this charge hub would be able to power a small cell phone.

items.name: Shirk Blubber
items.desc: It bounces and makes wet slapping noises when you throw it against things.

items.name: Shirk Beakfragment
items.desc: It probably hurt when this was ripped from a Shirk's face, but Shirks probably don't have emotions or self-awareness, so it's not that big of a deal.

items.name: Sodium Chunk
items.desc: You managed to squeeze this whopping sodium chunk out of a domesticated Shirk's salt gland. And you only nearly lost a limb!

items.name: Shirk Plumage
items.desc: These feathers give Shirks their beautiful, glorious majesty. They truly are nature's most beautiful carnivorous flying bird shark monsters.

items.name: Shirk Saltgland
items.desc: Shirks like an extra pinch of salt on their meals, so this salt gland really comes in handy for such occasions.

items.name: Lyff Crystalshard
items.desc: Legends say that Lyffs will give shards of their crystals to those they consider friends. What legends? You know... the legends.

items.name: Lyff Donglespring
items.desc: The only organ a Lyff uses to get around. It makes a loud 'BOING' sound when you pull it back and release.

items.name: Lyff Leather
items.desc: The skin is quite thin, but it's covered in an incredibly thick mat of fur. So thick, in fact, that it might not be fur at all. It might just be more skin.

items.name: Lyff Swimbladder
items.desc: When a Lyff wants to go for a dip, this puppy keeps it afloat. It's so effective that Lyffs can't swim more than a foot or so underwater without popping back up.

items.name: Lyfftongue
items.desc: It's coarse and covered in bumps. If you rub it on your cheek, nothing happens.

items.name: Gallum Warpcore
items.desc: Torn from the chest cavity of a Gallum, this warp core might be useful for something involving warping.

items.name: Gallum Rib
items.desc: These ribs provide protection for the warp core of a Gallum. Not enough protection, apparently, because you easily pried it out with your bare hands.

items.name: Gallum Meat
items.desc: This meat holds the ribs of a Gallum together. Throw that in a pot with some salt and pepper, and baby, you've got a stew going.

items.name: Gallum Armor
items.desc: This would be one of the toughest substances known to mankind, if it were substantially tougher... and known to mankind.

items.name: Gulanti Blowhole
items.desc: You ripped that Gulanti a new, slightly bigger blowhole in exactly the same place as its old one.

items.name: Gulanti Calcite
items.desc: It gets warm when you hold fire to it, but it stops getting warm when you take the fire away.

items.name: Gulanti Chomper
items.desc: Gulantis probably use these serrated edges to tear the meat from the bones of their innocent victims, or possibly for carpentry.

items.name: Gulanti Elecore
items.desc: You know that feeling when you rub your socks on the carpet, then touch something, and it zaps you? Touching this thing feels nothing like that.

items.name: Gulanti Zeolite
items.desc: Whatever you put this next to, it makes that thing seem way more awesome. It's extracted from a domesticated Gulanti!

items.name: Slurbshell
items.desc: When you gaze upon the lustrous sheen of the shell, you begin to hallucinate that you are stranded alone on a planet, fighting for your survival while trying to defeat a limbless alien.

items.name: Slurb Electrucus
items.desc: Acquired from a domesticated Slurb. Is it mucus? Is it electric? Yes.

items.name: Slurb Magnet
items.desc: Slurbs probably use these to amplify their aerobatic spins. This magnet has impeccable craftsmanship.

items.name: Slurb Spine
items.desc: It's so insanely pointy, you could probably attach it to something, then poke stuff with that thing, and it would hurt a lot.

items.name: Blastcrab Shell
items.desc: It's not very firm under normal conditions, but it hardens instantly when exposed to explosions.

items.name: Blastcrab Ignition Gland
items.desc: Much like a grill lighter, this gland sends sparks into the Blastcrab's body and lights... whatever is in there.

items.name: Blastcrab Hydrocarbon
items.desc: Pulled from a blast tube of a domesticated Blastcrab, this compound makes your breath flammable!

items.name: Blastcrab Hide
items.desc: It's tough and chewy! Almost too chewy...

items.name: Gallium
items.desc: This high-energy goo binds the cosmic energy of the Gallum's crystals together. If you treat a domesticated Gallum well, it might give you some!

items.name: Glowb
items.desc: You've packed about as much glow juice into one place as you possibly can. This thing should stay lit for... FRICKIN' EONS.

items.name: Skinnery
items.desc: Now you're crafting with Wompit parts!

items.name: Shirkbeak Pickaxe
items.desc: Tier 4 pickaxe. The hair bristles pleasantly against the palm of your hand as you wield it.

items.name: Shredbasket
items.desc: If you put a piece of bread into it, you would end up with more pieces of bread.

items.name: Fursmasher
items.desc: Level 25 Hammer. The plumage on the hilt really gives it a nice counterbalanced heft.

items.name: Smat
items.desc: Level 25 Helm. The last thing your enemies will remember is the shining glimmer of your beautiful shirkbeak smile.

items.name: Smock
items.desc: Level 25 Chest. Smashblossom parts can really take a pounding, and now, so can you!

items.name: Smitts
items.desc: Level 25 Glove. The yolk is pretty sticky, but it keeps the gloves firmly cemented onto your hands. It's a trade-off.

items.name: Smants
items.desc: Level 25 Pants. The blubber does a great job of trapping the natural heat of your spicy legs, which is pretty important in the cold of the Tundra.

items.name: Poorly Repaired Shirk Egg
items.desc: It's a patchy job, but most Shirks are just dumb enough to fall for it. Embiggens your Shirk to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Pressure Cooker
items.desc: Be sure not to put your face in front of this while it's running, unless you're into horrifying spa treatments.

items.name: Gastropestle
items.desc: Like the chemistry set you had as a kid, but morbid.

items.name: Antlerhoof Trowel
items.desc: Tier 3 trowel. Antlers and hooves are terrible at prying things off the ground, until you combine them. In a sense, they're like the mustard and mayonnaise of a deviled egg.

items.name: Saggy Healing Potion
items.desc: The sagtatoe container really brings out the flavonoids. Restores 6,521 HP.

items.name: Elixir of Siphoning
items.desc: Juicing up with this bad boy lets you SUCK THE LIFE FROM EVERYONE AROUND YOU! 2% chance to regain health upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Smashy Healbev
items.desc: With this much protein, you could seriously consider getting into squats. Restores 17,894 HP.

items.name: Elixir of Temporary Insanity
items.desc: This disgusting fluid makes you REALLY UPSET. 3% chance per second to go berserk upon striking. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Dirt
items.desc: It's dirty.

items.name: Furdle Durt
items.desc: You can plant seeds in it! It's so furdle and durty!.

items.name: Squebab
items.desc: Stabbing a Squeti with a spine makes for a great kebab! Oh, but remind your pet to remove the skewer before eating it. Restores 66,240 HP.

items.name: Gaze Catcher
items.desc: If there's one thing a Glaser can't resist, it's a space traveler in tight spandex flinging a ball of awkwardly-assembled objects at it. Embiggens your Glaser to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Hardcore Stomord
items.desc: Level 27 Sword. Although Glaser stomachs don't make for very good building components, they work much better once you stab them with everything else.

items.name: Gloots
items.desc: Level 27 Pants. The stranglers keep all your parts packed in tight!

items.name: Glasevest
items.desc: Level 27 Chest. It protect, lifts, and supports! Your dignity, that is.

items.name: Hardhat
items.desc: Level 27 Helm. It'll protect your face so hard, you won't even know what hit you. Seriously, you'll have no idea.

items.name: Stomagloves
items.desc: Level 27 Glove. The high levels of acid on the inside will definitely render your hands soft and tender. Everyone loves soft hands!

items.name: Slurry Processing
items.desc: By dumping slurry into the Slurrifier, you'll be able to clean it up and extract something useful from it.

items.name: Slurrifier
items.desc: It seems that the slurry you get from geysirs might contain valuable resources. This station will let you extract all the delicious goodness!

items.name: Karboan
items.desc: This was covered in some Geysir Slurry, and you managed to clean it up. It's pretty rough around the edges, but it might be good for something.

items.name: Technium
items.desc: It's hard and scratch-proof, and polished to a perfect sheen. Nothing you do seems to dent it, and it hums gently when you come near it.

items.name: Meltor
items.desc: This toxic goo is a primary component of slurry. It sticks to everything it touches, including your nostrils.

items.name: Karbopole
items.desc: Tier 3 fishing pole. It's long, hard, and thorny. Like a fishing pole should be.

items.name: Tumbler
items.desc: Fully equipped for all your tumbling needs, this Tumbler even comes with a cupholder! In the sense that you can put a cup near it.

items.name: Elixir of Resilience
items.desc: It smells like waffles without syrup. Reduces physical damage taken by 15%. Elixir lasts 20 minutes.

items.name: Karbaxe
items.desc: Level 29 Axe. When swung hard enough, ice skates can become deadly weapons. Like most things, probably.

items.name: Karbelm
items.desc: Level 29 Helm. You could put a lot of eyes out with these things.

items.name: Slest
items.desc: Level 29 Chest. Nothing insulates your saucy torso like a Squeti.

items.name: Sloves
items.desc: Level 29 Glove. Poofy shoulderpads are IN! Fashion is cyclical, right? ... Right?

items.name: Sloots
items.desc: Level 29 Pants. Sloots with the fur, to protect your beautiful calves from the biting cold.

items.name: Magnetic Bracelet
items.desc: Slurbs rely on magnetism to powercharge their leaps. Embiggens your Slurb to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Spinesaw
items.desc: Tier 5 saw. The jagged spines of Slurbs make for an amazing saw. They are also great conversation starters and enders!

items.name: Burnchurn
items.desc: Good thing it runs on its own, or you'd end up with a lot of disfiguring scars!

items.name: Flungmallet
items.desc: Level 31 Hammer. Although soft and filled with air, flungus pods can do some serious damage in the very, very long term. Years, maybe.

items.name: Lyff Toy Bauble
items.desc: Lyffs are super playful, so this toy-ish baubley thing should win one over pretty easily. Embiggens your Lyff to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Thinkingcap
items.desc: Level 31 Helm. Wearing this cap infuses your cerebrum with the mental faculties of a Flungus. It also removes your depth perception, which is a plus.

items.name: Florset
items.desc: Level 31 Chest. It's tight, which is what makes it so nice.

items.name: Tonguemitts
items.desc: Level 31 Glove. Wrapping a Lyff tongue around your hand has augmented the sounds of your slaps to become very satisfying.

items.name: Floots
items.desc: Level 31 Pants. The fluff feels good in between your toes. Or it would, if you had some.

items.name: Icy Pickaxe
items.desc: Tier 5 pickaxe. Be careful not to poke your parts with the spiky ball part of the pick.

items.name: Refinery
items.desc: Pump it up and process it down! This bad boy will turn all that bubblin' crude into whatever your little heart desires!

items.name: Alloyonite
items.desc: It's hard, round, and smooth. Despite its toughness, it has just enough give to make for some pretty good bounces.

items.name: Redhat
items.desc: Level 33 Helm. It's just heavy enough that you might break your neck wearing it. That's how you know it's good.

items.name: Redcoat
items.desc: Level 33 Chest. It's strong enough for a man, and also strong enough for a woman. Because women and men are equal.

items.name: Redsleeves
items.desc: Level 33 Glove. It looks sharp on the outside, but it's even sharper on the inside. You should seek medical attention.

items.name: Redboots
items.desc: Level 33 Pants. These boots will grant you the style of one eagle and the finesse of another eagle, high-fiving as they soar through space.

items.name: Redpoker
items.desc: Level 33 Sword. Look at this sword. You could poke the whole world with this thing.

items.name: Bagpump
items.desc: It makes horrible squealing noises as it extracts oil from the waters of the Tundra. It makes you feel like dancing.

items.name: Oilbag
items.desc: Priming your Bagpump with an Icequill lets you extract this from the water. It's oily on the outside, and oilier on the inside!

items.name: Oiled Calcite Trowel
items.desc: Tier 4 trowel. The grip is pretty slippery, but it should get the job done.

items.name: Blastcrab Firebarrel
items.desc: Blastcrabs care about one thing only, and that's burning everything. Embiggens your Blastcrab to POWERFUL SIZE!

items.name: Foundry
items.desc: It runs pretty hot, but not very fast. You could probably beat it in a marathon, or with a stick.

items.name: Lonsdaxe
items.desc: Level 35 Axe. It's heavy, awkward, pointy, and dangerous. Just like your ex-spouse.

items.name: Lonsdelm
items.desc: Level 35 Helm. It fits so snugly over your skull, you can barely hear, think, see, or breathe. So protective!

items.name: Lonschest
items.desc: Level 35 Chest. It grips your ribs with the strength of a thousand dung beetles!

items.name: Lonsmitts
items.desc: Level 35 Glove. The blowhole makes for a great seal, and the hard outer covering makes for a great hard outer covering! All in all, 3/5 stars.

items.name: Lonsboots
